title: areYouLate() â€” A Python-Powered Transit Assistant
description: A Python console-based assistant that decodes GTFS (General Transit Feed Specification) data to provide live bus arrivals, real-time vehicle locations, service alerts. Built as a personal milestone project to apply programming skills from first-year Computer Science at Dalhousie University.
shortDescription: A Python assistant to check live bus arrivals, locations, and service alerts using GTFS data.
alt: A bus speeding to its destination

title: Portfolio Site
description: A static page showcasing my latest projects. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
alt: An image of a computer screen with code

title: Blender Render Utilities - A Blender addon
description: An addon that provides quick access to resolution presets for popular screen ratios. It tool simplifies setting up render resolutions for social media content, filmmaking, and custom aspect ratios, making it easier for creators to maintain consistency across various formats.
shortDescription: An addon that simplifies setting up render resolutions for different screen ratios.
alt: A 3d render of a car on a bridge at sunset

title: Summer Research @ Vertex Lab
description: Research funded by an Undergraduate Student Research Award (USRA) from the Faculty of Computer Science and the Imhotep Legacy Academy. My Research looks at "How Users Interact with 3D Virtual Spaces and How UI Design Influences Perception"
shortDescription: Undergraduate student research on user interaction and perception in 3D virtual spaces.

title: Nia: A Black Youth Led Summit
description: An empowering summit organized by and for Black youth, focusing on leadership, community engagement, cultural celebration, and creating spaces for Black voices to thrive.
shortDescription: A youth-led summit fostering Black leadership, empowerment, and community connection.
